LJava
Class Relation

java.lang.Object
  LJava.Association
      LJava.Relation
All Implemented Interfaces:
LJ.QueryParameter
Direct Known Subclasses:
Formula
public class Relation
extends Association
implements LJ.QueryParameter

Author:
Tzali Maimon Relation is a fact that has an order to its arguments. the name of a Relation is like a key.

So you can write a rule coolLibrary(LJ,"really cool") like this: new Relation("coolLibrary", LJ, "really cool")

Relations are Associations so you can place them as rules in the "world" of LJ
